executiveSummary: Jared Steel, founder of Terishroom from Austin, Texas, pitched his fully automated mushroom-growing device on Shark Tank, seeking $175,000 for 2.5% equity. Despite strong pre-sales and an innovative concept, the Sharks declined to invest due to lack of shipped products, overengineering concerns, and valuation disagreements.
keyDecisions: No major decisions recorded; no investment deal was made.
nextSteps: Terishroom plans to begin shipping its first 1,140 units to the Austin warehouse by July and continue moving toward product delivery and mass production.
